ucid-0.content:
Commentia prototype build: v0.0.1a

What is Commentia?

A lightweight, no-DB comment system (flat-file), using the powerful JSON-format, allowing for human-editability of the "database".

It can:

  • Allow members to post formatted comments with Markdown
  • Allow members to reply to existing comments
  • Allow members to delete comments
    • The delete-behaviour is implemented, such that it overwrites only the comment to be deleted with the string [[deleted]]. This is to preserve the child comments, as deleting one comment does not necessarily warrant the deletion of all the child comments, together with the parent.
  • Do role-based operations, such as:
    • Allow admin members to delete/edit any comment, and do what normal members can
    • Whereas normal members can reply to existing comments/publish new comments, but only delete/edit their own comments

What does the future have in store?

  • A guest-mode, which can easily be enabled/disabled in the config file, allowing basic functionality without needing to log in
  • An easy sign-up form
  • Displaying the user's avatar next to the comment
  • Logging in using an existing Google account
  • And any other features requested (as long as they're feasible)...

ucid-1.content: And it does seem to work pretty well for now...

ucid-2.content:
Multipage in one file

A major advantage of Commentia is the efficient use of JSON-files. One comments JSON file can hold a multitude of pages, and this makes it possible to, with the help of a JSON editor, edit any comments by hand.

Once again:

Allowing the human to easily edit the comments is a key concept. Take note that the JSON-file itself is made for the admin (who can use HTML and edit things accordingly), but the front-end is abstracted away into the easy-to-use Markdown language for the general user.
